metadata.title: Commercial Tenant Improvement Permit Submission Checklist
metadata.source: SF DBI permit processing requirements, sf.gov commercial TI guidelines
metadata.scope: Commercial tenant improvement projects — office, retail, restaurant, assembly
notes: Complements the residential pre-plan check checklist (completeness-checklist.json)
Commercial TI projects have additional agency routing triggers not present in residential
Restaurant/food service TIs require DPH review in addition to standard DBI review
Projects in historic districts require additional HPC review documentation

primary.selection_logic: Form 8 for OTC-eligible commercial TI; Form 3 for in-house review
primary.notes: Most commercial TIs use Form 3 unless scope is minor (paint, flooring, fixtures only)

supplemental_forms.when_required: Change of use or occupancy classification change
supplemental_forms.example: Office to restaurant, retail to assembly

supplemental_forms.selection: GS-1 for new commercial, GS-5 for alterations; see green-building-requirements.json

supplemental_forms.when_required: Any modification to fire sprinkler system
New or modified fire alarm system

must_show: Means of egress from tenant space to public way
ADA accessible route from public way to tenant space
Existing and proposed layout (demo plan + new work plan)
ADA clearances at doors, corridors, restrooms

reflected_ceiling_plan.required: When modifying ceiling, lighting, or HVAC

structural_plans.required: When modifying structure or adding significant loads
must_show: Structural calculations signed by licensed engineer
Load path for new equipment (e.g., rooftop HVAC)

triggers: Formula retail (chain store) in neighborhood commercial district
Assembly occupancy (A-1, A-2, A-3) — any occupant load
Kitchen hood / Type I exhaust system
Change from B to A or M occupancy
All commercial TIs require ADA/CBC Chapter 11B compliance review
Path of travel upgrades may be required for alterations > $195,348 (2024 threshold)
Restroom modifications trigger full ADA restroom compliance

common_rejection_reasons.description: Floor plans must show occupant load per room using CBC Table 1004.5 factors. Total building occupant load determines exit requirements.
common_rejection_reasons.fix: Add occupant load table to plans showing: room, area, load factor, calculated load

common_rejection_reasons.description: Travel distance, exit width, and number of exits must be shown on plans and comply with CBC Chapter 10.
common_rejection_reasons.fix: Mark exit paths on floor plans with distances. Verify exit width >= occupant load / 0.2 per inch

common_rejection_reasons.description: Projects over the path-of-travel threshold must upgrade accessible route, restrooms, drinking fountains, telephones, and signage to current standards.
common_rejection_reasons.fix: Show compliant 36" min corridors, 60" turning radius, lever hardware, compliant restroom layout

common_rejection_reasons.description: Demising walls, corridor walls, and shaft enclosures must show fire rating. UL assembly numbers required.
common_rejection_reasons.fix: Provide UL assembly number and detail for each rated wall/floor/ceiling assembly

common_rejection_reasons.description: Mechanical plans must show outdoor air rates per CBC Chapter 4 / ASHRAE 62.1.
common_rejection_reasons.fix: Add ventilation schedule showing cfm per person and per area for each occupied space

common_rejection_reasons.description: Lighting power density and HVAC efficiency must meet current Title 24 Part 6.
common_rejection_reasons.fix: Include Certificate of Compliance (CF-1R for lighting, CF-1R-MFM for mechanical)

common_rejection_reasons.description: When occupancy classification changes, full CBC compliance for new occupancy is required.
common_rejection_reasons.fix: Provide existing and proposed occupancy on cover sheet, address all applicable code sections for new occupancy

common_rejection_reasons.description: Commercial kitchen projects need Type I hood calculations and grease interceptor sizing.
common_rejection_reasons.fix: Show hood cfm calculation per CMC, grease interceptor size per plumbing code, SFFD suppression system

eligible_scopes: Cosmetic changes only (paint, flooring, ceiling tiles — no layout change)
Adding outlets or lights to existing circuits (no panel modification)
not_eligible: Any change of use or occupancy
Modifying fire sprinkler or alarm systems
